This example tutorial illustrates:
Tutorial WIKI
http://wiki.eclipse.org/EclipseLink/Examples/JPA/OC4J_Web_Tutorial
Demo URL:
http://127.0.0.1:8888/enterprise/FrontController?action=demo

- Deployment of a simple servlet client based JPA EAR application on an Oracle OC4J 10.1.3.5 Server
- No use of a Web application framework like JSF, Struts or client side Ajax - so minimize setup conflicts - Pure JPA - no native ORM at this point unless required as a workaround for the container - Container managed entity manager where possible - except for DDL generation - Smallest entity model possible - a single entity with a @ManyToMany to itself - Entity model has no container specific annotations - Use of a transactional container managed JPA EclipseLink entityManager on a stateless session bean
- How to integrate with the Oracle OC4J Server plugin for the Eclipse IDE


Requirements:
- Oracle OC4J 10.1.3.5 or 10.1.4 Application Server
- A database (Oracle 11 is used by this example)
- populated schema (run the following JPA SE project to populate your database) http://dev.eclipse.org/svnroot/rt/org.eclipse.persistence/trunk/examples/org.eclipse.persistence.example.jpa.server.common.ddlgen/ - an HTML browser

Modifications:
- modify persistence.xml for your particular database if not using Oracle
